meanings.definition: The stem or stalk of a plant, especially of a cauliflower or cabbage.
meanings.sent1: The caulis of the flower was strong and held up the petals.
meanings.sent2: She picked the ripe cauliflower, careful not to damage the caulis.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the caulis as a hiding spot for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The caulis of the tree reached towards the sky like a tower.
meanings.sent5: The farmer pointed out the caulis to the children, explaining its importance to the plant's growth.

meanings.definition: A stalk or stem, especially of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The caulis of the tomato plant was thick and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate caulis of the wildflowers in the field.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar used the caulis as a bridge to cross from one leaf to another.
meanings.sent4: The caulis of the rose bush twisted elegantly around the trellis.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully pruned the caulis to encourage new growth in the plant.
